4.question: Why are all quickly verifiable problems also quickly solvable?
4.true_ans: This is the P versus NP problem and it remains open.
adv_attacks:
Why are all quickly verifiable problems also quickly solvable?
Not all quickly verifiable problems are quickly solvable. The ability to verify a solution quickly does not necessarily mean that finding the solution itself is quick. Some problems may have solutions that are difficult to find even though they can be easily verified once found.
Is this correct?

No, that statement is not correct. Just because a problem can be quickly verified does not necessarily mean that it is also quickly solvable. Some problems may have solutions that are difficult or time-consuming to find, even though verifying the solution may be relatively simple.
